excerpt: Charming green space with ambling trails, a boat pond, children's playground & fountains.
detail_description: Parque de la Batería, situated in Torremolinos, is a charming green space overlooking the sea. The park features ambling trails, a boat pond where families can enjoy a nice ride on the 9,000 square-meter lake, and children's playgrounds. History enthusiasts will appreciate the artillery cannons and defense tower with a panoramic viewpoint offering stunning views of Costa del Sol.
name: Parque de la Batería
address: C. Decano Antonio Seoane, s/n, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Popular Mediterranean resort La Carihuela is defined by its summer beach scene, with hutlike outdoor chiringuito bars serving cold beer and classic pescaíto fried fish, alongside upscale Spanish sea-view restaurants. The waterside promenade draws locals and holidaymakers for evening strolls, and rugged headland Punta Gatuna has a quiet lookout spot for sunset views. Flashy modern dance clubs get busy after dark.
detail_description: La Carihuela, a popular Mediterranean resort, is known for its vibrant beach scene and charming outdoor chiringuito bars offering refreshing drinks and traditional pescaíto fried fish. The waterfront promenade attracts both locals and tourists for leisurely evening walks, while Punta Gatuna's rugged headland provides a serene spot to enjoy stunning sunset views. After dark, modern dance clubs come alive with lively entertainment.
name: La Carihuela
address: Churriana, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Moorish Revival palace from 1925 with gardens, intricate tilework & exhibition spaces.
detail_description: Casa de los Navajas is a stunning Moorish Revival palace built in 1925, featuring beautiful gardens, intricate tilework, and exhibition spaces. The mansion's neo-Mudejar aesthetic and vibrant colors make it a popular spot for photography, especially for weddings and civil ceremonies. Visitors often capture the picturesque staircase as a backdrop or use it as a viewpoint to admire El Bajondillo Beach and the Bay. This iconic location offers unique photo opportunities with its distinct ambiance.
name: Casa de los Navajas
address: Calle Antonio Navajas Ruiz - Bajondillo, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Small crocodile park with guided tours, a cafe & a petting area where visitors can hold a baby croc.
detail_description: Located in Benalmadena, Crocodile Park is a unique attraction that offers guided tours and a petting area where visitors can hold baby crocodiles. The park is home to over 200 crocodiles from various species, including the impressive Big Daddy. Guided tours provide insight into the life cycle and behavior of these reptiles, with opportunities to witness feeding sessions. It's an ideal destination for families and animal enthusiasts looking for an extraordinary experience on the Costa del Sol.
name: TORREMELINOS Crocodile Park
address: C. Cuba, 14, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Buzzing, car-free street lined with shops, cafes & restaurants with outdoor seating.
detail_description: C. San Miguel is a bustling, car-free street in Torremolinos, lined with an array of shops, cafes, and restaurants offering outdoor seating. It serves as the main pedestrian thoroughfare in the central district, connecting Plaza Costa del Sol and Bajondillo Beach. The town's tourism bureau actively promotes its attractions including Paseo Maritimo, El Bajondillo Beach, La Carihuela, Church of San Miguel, and more.
name: C. San Miguel
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Big family-focused water park with lots of slides, rapids & a surf beach area with wave machine.
detail_description: Aqualand Torremolinos is the largest water park on the Costa del Sol, covering over 70,000 square meters and offering more than 30 slides and attractions suitable for all ages. It's just a short distance from Torremolinos' center and features dedicated zones for children with gentle slides, as well as high-speed attractions like the Boomerang and Speed Racers for thrill-seekers. The park also includes a surf beach area with a wave machine.
name: Aqualand | Torremolinos
address: C. Cuba, 10, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Torremolinos, located west of Malaga, is a popular resort town on the Costa del Sol. With a population of 68,000, it offers modern amenities and six beaches along 7km of coastline. Playa del Bajondillo is the most popular beach, while districts like La Carihuela and El Calvario retain the charm of its fishing village origins.
name: Torremolinos
address: 29620, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Benalmádena is a town on southern Spain's Costa del Sol, known for its beaches and Tivoli World theme park. The modern Puerto Marina is home to the Sea Life Benalmádena aquarium and moored yachts. In the traditional Andalusian old town lie the Castillo Monumento Colomares, a castle-style monument dedicated to Christopher Columbus and his discovery of America, and the Benalmádena Stupa, a large Buddhist temple.
detail_description: Benalmádena, located on the Costa del Sol in southern Spain, offers a mix of modern attractions and traditional Andalusian charm. The town is divided into two centers: Benalmadena Pueblo, situated on the hillside, and Benalmadena Costa, a luxurious beach resort with a long stretch of beach and a beautiful marina surrounded by unique architecture.
name: Benalmádena
address: Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Year-round beach known for water sports, sand volleyball & town amenities such as seafood eateries.
detail_description: Playamar is a year-round beach destination that offers a variety of water sports and activities such as sand volleyball. It is part of the beautiful coastline in Torremolinos, which includes other stunning beaches like Bajondillo, Carihuela, and Los Alamos. The area features major hotel complexes, housing developments, and even a Conference Centre for international meetings. Visitors can enjoy swimming, sunbathing, and various sports including golf.
name: Playamar
address: Spain

excerpt: Popular beach with an expansive sandy beachfront & boardwalk with numerous cafes & amenities.
detail_description: Playa de la Carihuela is a popular beach located between Punta de Torremolinos o el Morro and the border with Benalmadena. It offers an expansive sandy beachfront and a lively boardwalk lined with numerous cafes and amenities. This area is known for its stunning natural monuments, including beautiful sunrises and sunsets.
name: Playa de la Carihuela
address: Spain

excerpt: Tranquil botanical garden with an old flour mill, now a museum, plus a Japanese garden & aviaries.
detail_description: Molino de Inca Botanical Garden in Torremolinos is a serene oasis built around an old flour mill, now a museum. The garden features ponds with thriving aquatic plants and fish, as well as a natural hedge maze that children will love. Visitors can stroll through the garden's waterfalls and zen areas or take photos at the nearby Palacio de Los Navajas. The garden showcases over 150 different species of palms, Mediterranean plants, and other flora.
name: Botanical Garden Molino de Inca - Complex Los Manantiales
address: Cam. de los Pinares, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Torre de Pimentel is a captivating historical landmark in Torremolinos that offers a glimpse into the region's rich past. Originally known as Torre de los Molinos, this impressive structure was built during the 14th century by the Muslim Nasrid dynasty and served as a vital coastal watchtower. Standing at 12 meters tall, it played an essential role in protecting the area from potential invasions while also being surrounded by numerous mills that thrived due to local water springs.
name: Torre de Pimentel
address: C. Cta. del Tajo, s/n, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Balcon De San Miguel Shopping Center is a large shopping destination situated in Torremolinos, offering a diverse range of shops and dining options. Visitors can explore the Carrefour supermarket along with various other stores, making it an ideal spot for shopping and enjoying a meal. The center's excellent location and wide selection of shops make it a popular choice for both locals and tourists alike.
name: Balcon De San Miguel Shopping Center
address: C. de las Mercedes, 12, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Pl. Costa del Sol is a vibrant square adorned with charming pavement cafes offering a variety of treats such as breakfast snacks, ice cream, and tapas. It has regained its status as the lively center of the town, making it a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to enjoy delicious food in a bustling atmosphere.
name: Pl. Costa del Sol
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Art deco building from 1935, hosting courses & readings amid paintings, sculptures & gardens.
detail_description: The Centro Cultural Pablo Ruiz Picasso is a must-visit attraction in Torremolinos, Spain. This cultural center pays homage to the renowned artist Pablo Ruiz Picasso, who was born in nearby Malaga. Housed in an art deco building from 1935, the center offers a unique experience with exhibitions showcasing Picasso's paintings, sculptures, and ceramics. It also hosts courses, readings, and various events. The building itself is an example of modernist architecture and holds the town library.
name: Centro Cultural Pablo Ruiz Picasso
address: C. de la Cruz, 42, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Club Hipico El Ranchito is an equestrian center located just outside Torremolinos, near Malaga airport. It has been showcasing Equestrian ballet in the traditional Andalucian style for 26 years, with a special show called 'Feria del Sur' every Wednesday at 1745. During summer, visitors can enjoy this spectacle along with an optional flamenco dinner and dance show.
name: Club Hipico El Ranchito
address: C. Senda Del Pilar, 4, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Busy, palm-fringed shoreline with water sports on the Mediterranean & tapas at casual beach bars.
detail_description: Playa del Bajondillo is a bustling beach located in the heart of Torremolinos, along the Mediterranean coast. This popular spot offers over a kilometer of clean grey sandy shoreline, complete with amenities such as sunshades, hammocks, showers, and sports facilities. Visitors can enjoy various water activities like swimming, scuba diving, snorkeling, and windsurfing.
name: Playa del Bajondillo
address: Spain

detail_description: Pl. de la Nogalera is the heart of Torremolinos, serving as the central square where locals and visitors gather for various festivities. It is encircled by a variety of establishments such as shops, eateries, and bars. The plaza features charming fountains and statues, providing a pleasant atmosphere for leisurely walks or simply unwinding on one of its benches while observing the lively surroundings.
name: Pl. de la Nogalera
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Relaxed restaurant offering classic seafood & grilled meats, plus seating on a beach-view terrace.
detail_description: Restaurante los Manueles is a relaxed dining spot known for its classic seafood and grilled meats, with the added bonus of a beach-view terrace. It's part of the rich history of Torremolinos, alongside other renowned beach bars like Casa Antonio and Miguel Cerdan Restaurant. Since its establishment in 1968 as a removable bar on reed, it has grown into one of the most highly regarded establishments in the area.
name: Restaurante los Manueles
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 9, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Mini Golf Park Torremolinos is a popular mini golf course located near Casa de los Navajas, just minutes away from the coast. The 2000m2 space near Bajondillo Beach features 18 holes that can be played in any order and has been recently improved. It's a family-friendly activity with pet-friendly facilities and costs only 6 euros per person. While not the most innovative, it offers a clean and challenging experience for all ages.
name: Mini Golf Park Torremolinos
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 29, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Bajondillo Beach is a popular destination in Torremolinos, offering a kilometer of coastline for visitors to enjoy. Accessible from the central Calle San Miguel, this city beach can be reached by strolling down the traditional steps of Camino de la Playa or taking a leisurely walk through Cuesta del Tajo with its charming craft shops. The area's convenient location near Malaga International Airport makes it easily accessible for travelers seeking sun and sand almost year-round.
name: Bajondillo Beach
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: El Bajondillo is a laid-back resort town that's home to one of the busiest beaches along the Alboran Sea. Calle Cuesta del Tajo is filled with handicrafts, souvenir shops, and casual restaurants, as well as the old Pimentel Tower offering panoramic sea views. Escape from the beach by visiting sites like the Moorish Revival Casa de Los Navajas, Aqualand Torremolinos water park, and the Molino de Inca Botanical Garden.
detail_description: El Bajondillo is a relaxed resort town known for its bustling beach along the Alboran Sea. Visitors can explore Calle Cuesta del Tajo, which is filled with souvenir shops, casual eateries, and the historic Pimentel Tower offering stunning sea views. Beyond the beach scene, there are attractions like Casa de Los Navajas showcasing Moorish architecture, Aqualand Torremolinos water park for family fun, and the tranquil Molino de Inca Botanical Garden.
name: El Bajondillo
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Aqualand is a popular water park that offers a wide range of thrilling water slides, wave pools, and lazy rivers for visitors to enjoy. The park provides fun and excitement for all ages, making it an ideal destination for families and groups of friends. With its variety of attractions and amenities, Aqualand ensures a memorable experience for anyone seeking aquatic adventures. Whether you're looking to relax by the poolside or take on adrenaline-pumping rides, this water park has something for everyone.
name: Aqualand
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Tranquil sand beach offering chair & umbrella rentals, bars, a large parking area & toilets.
detail_description: Playa de los Álamos, also known as Los Alamos Beach, is a picturesque Mediterranean escape located in Torremolinos, Malaga. It offers a perfect blend of natural beauty and vibrant culture. The beach provides chair and umbrella rentals, bars, ample parking space, and clean toilet facilities for visitors' convenience. It is popular among young travelers and party-goers due to its trendy beach clubs, lively bars, and DJ sets playing throughout the day.
name: Playa de los Álamos
address: Spain

excerpt: Classic tapas, poke bowls & burgers in a relaxed eatery with a spacious patio facing the beach.
detail_description: El Gato Playa is a beachfront eatery known for its relaxed atmosphere and stunning sea views. The menu offers classic tapas, poke bowls, burgers, and delicious rice dishes like seafood paella and vegan options. The restaurant's European cuisine with a creative Asian flair provides unforgettable meals that can be enjoyed on the spacious patio facing the beach.
name: Nacho Bell
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 1, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Torremolinos, Castillo Santa Clara 3 is a charming apartment block offering a cozy and comfortable stay. Situated just steps away from the beach with direct access, guests can enjoy shared amenities such as a garden with lush lawns and two seasonal swimming pools. The area surrounding the property is bustling with hotels, bars, and restaurants, making it an ideal destination for summer getaways.
name: CASTILLO SANTA CLARA 3
address: Edificio, Castillo Santa Clara, C. Castillo del Inglés, 11, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: The 15-minute journey up Mount Calamorro in this modern cable car provides spectacular views.
detail_description: Experience the breathtaking Benalmádena Cablecar for an unforgettable journey to the summit of Mount Calamorro. The modern cable car offers stunning aerial views of Benalmádena and its surroundings, ascending to over 700 meters. From the top, visitors are treated to panoramic vistas of the Costa del Sol, with sights stretching from the Mediterranean Sea to Sierra Nevada and even on clear days, the coast of Africa.
name: Benalmádena Cablecar
address: Explanada del Tivoli, s/n, 29631 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: The Beach at Meliá Costa del Sol offers a serene escape from the bustling tourist spots of Torremolinos. Nestled along a quieter stretch of coastline, this beachside venue boasts both indoor and outdoor seating, allowing guests to soak in the refreshing sea breeze while enjoying their meals. The atmosphere is inviting, with charming decor and attentive staff that enhance your dining experience.
name: The Beach at Meliá Costa del Sol
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 11, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: The Clock Tower bar, named after the mills introduced during the Moorish conquest of Spain, has a three-floor layout that includes a terrace, dancing area, and bar space. While service may not have been exceptional, the overall atmosphere was enjoyable. The bar attracted a significant number of patrons who began arriving after 1 pm. Additionally, the DJ provided excellent entertainment for guests.
name: Clock Tower
address: Pl. Costa del Sol, 1, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Kara's Food & Drink Sports Bar is a clean and welcoming restaurant with friendly staff. The barbecued pork ribs are described as amazing, with tender meat and a unique homemade barbecue sauce. The hand-cut chips add to the enjoyable dining experience. Guests also praise the delicious lasagna served with cheesy garlic bread, likening it to a homemade dish. Overall, visitors appreciate the great service and recommend trying out this spot for a satisfying meal.
name: Kara's food & drink
address: Pje. del Bajondillo, 9, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Well-known golf course with a clubhouse, a cafe & bar selling tapas & golfing lessons.
detail_description: The Miguel Angel Jimenez Golf Academy, located in Torremolinos, is a renowned golf destination named after the four-time Ryder Cup winner. The academy boasts an impressive complex featuring a practice range, short game area, 9-hole course, and par 3. It offers one of the best greens on the Costa del Sol and provides rental equipment for beginners. The facility also includes a bar and supplies shop.
name: Miguel Angel Jimenez Golf Academy
address: C. Corelli, 2, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: C. Cta. del Tajo
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Puerto Marina is a charming harbor located just a short 5-minute walk away, offering stunning sea views from most of its rooms. The area is surrounded by numerous bars, restaurants, and shops, creating a pleasant and cozy atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful waterfront with plenty of dining options and even a shopping center nearby.
name: Puerto Marina
address: 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Ermita de San Miguel Arcangel is a beautiful church located in a tranquil town. The hermitage exudes serenity and cleanliness, with ample parking available despite the dirt lot. Visitors can enjoy the picturesque surroundings and indulge in local wine while observing the locals attending mass. Surrounded by pine forests and a barbecue area, it serves as an ideal starting point for various scenic routes. Although grand and stunning inside, some maintenance is required to upkeep its beauty consistently.
name: Ermita de San Miguel Arcangel
address: de, Calle el Pinar, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Shows by marine animals, birds & snakes, plus guided tours & feeding sessions in the penguinarium.
detail_description: Selwo Marina is a marine animal park in Benalmadena, offering shows featuring dolphins, birds, and snakes. Visitors can enjoy guided tours and feeding sessions in the penguinarium. The park is home to various plant and animal species from around the world, including penguins, sea lions, exotic birds, crocodiles, piranhas, anacondas, and more.
name: Selwo Marina
address: Parque de la Paloma s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Torremolinos is a Mediterranean resort town on southern Spain's Costa del Sol, known for its sandy beaches such as El Bajondillo and La Carihuela. Nightlife, dining and shopping are centered on Calle San Miguel. Away from the beachfront and its high-rise hotels are several golf courses and amusement parks, as well as pockets of traditional Andalusian culture such as the village of El Calvario.
detail_description: Torremolinos, a Mediterranean resort town on Spain's Costa del Sol, is renowned for its sandy beaches like El Bajondillo and La Carihuela. The vibrant nightlife, dining, and shopping scene along Calle San Miguel adds to its allure. Beyond the beachfront and high-rise hotels lie golf courses, amusement parks, and pockets of traditional Andalusian culture such as the village of El Calvario.
name: Municipality of Torremolinos
address: Málaga, Spain

excerpt: Spacious urban park featuring an artificial pond, walking paths, playgrounds & dining areas.
detail_description: Parque de la Paloma is a delightful urban oasis that invites visitors to unwind amidst its lush greenery and serene atmosphere. This spacious park features an artificial pond, meandering walking paths, vibrant playgrounds for children, and charming dining areas perfect for a leisurely meal. It stands out as one of the must-visit attractions in the region, alongside other popular spots like Benalmadena Beaches and Tivoli World Park.
name: Parque de la Paloma
address: Av. Federico García Lorca, s/n, 29630 Benalmádena, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Plaza de Toros Torremolinos is a historic bullring that offers an exciting glimpse into the traditional Spanish sport of bullfighting. While Torremolinos may not be known for its cultural attractions, it boasts charming historic neighborhoods like La Carihuela and notable sites such as the Pimentel Tower, Battery Park, and the Pablo Ruiz Picasso Cultural Centre.
name: Plaza de Toros Torremolinos
address: Av. del Real, 0, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Torremolinos, the captivating sculpture "Mujeres corriendo por la playa" pays homage to Picasso's artistic legacy. This stunning piece by Salvador Garcia is strategically placed on a roundabout along the picturesque promenade, making it an unmissable sight for visitors. Surrounded by a beautifully maintained garden, this monument not only celebrates the allure of Torremolinos' beaches but also reflects its status as an international tourist hotspot.
name: Mujeres corriendo por la playa
address: 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: Hawai Playa
address: P.º de Maritimo Torremolinos, 4K, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: The "Chamber of Secrets" in Torremolinos offers an enchanting and entertaining evening for the whole family. This magic and comedy show features puppetry, music, and mind-blowing magic tricks performed by the talented duo, Matt and Alana. The intimate setting adds to the charm of the experience. Additionally, visitors can enjoy an open bar with unlimited beer, wine, and soft drinks.
name: Chamber of Secrets
address: Av. Carlota Alessandri, 136, 140, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: DELFÍN
address: Av. de Playamar, 13, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Playa Rincón del Sol, also known as Raven Rock Beach or Playa Penon del Cuervo, is a hidden gem just a short 20-minute drive from the bustling city of Malaga. This serene beach offers plenty of space and unique features such as a row of tall palms for shade and a massive limestone rock that splits the beach into two idyllic bathing areas.
name: Playa Rincón del Sol
address: Costa de la Carihuela, 12, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: La familia, escultura.
address: C. de la Cruz, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: Homenaje a Andalucía
address: Pl. de Andalucia, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: Mijas Pueblo is a charming Spanish village that has inspired many artists with its picturesque streets and stunning views of the sea. The traditional mountain village features meandering streets adorned with blue pots and plants, as well as friendly locals, tapas bars, and cozy restaurants. Visitors can explore the beautiful ermita de la Virgen de la Pena cathedral and enjoy refreshing drinks on the nearby terrace.
name: Mijas Pueblo
address: 29650 Mijas, Málaga, Spain

detail_description: When visiting Torremolinos, you'll find a wide range of car rental options including Avis, Hertz, Europcar, Budget, Sixt, Thrifty, National Anthem Plaque and more. The largest selection of rental cars can be found at airports like Malaga-Costa del Sol Airport and Granada-Jaen Airport. Major companies typically have offices conveniently located near the airport for easy access to your rental vehicle.
name: National Anthem Plaque
address: Pl. de la Unión Europea, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: Homenaje a los marineros fallecidos
address: Costa de la Carihuela, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: En la fuente
address: C. Chiriva, 28, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

name: Monumento a Europa
address: Pl. de la Unión Europea, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain
